entry.p: One side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline route
One side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
Refer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
Refer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V.
Microstrip main route routing must be interleaved.
To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
